group_1.textRight: A feeling of helplessness...

group_1.textLeft: I think everyone's been feeling it to some extent.

group_1.textRight: I was aware that there was a general@sense of loss.
But with Rena's words in mind,@everything is now clicking together.
Tamaki sacrificed herself for us, and we've@been unable to repay her.
We should bear that in mind when we're doing@our check-ins with everyone.
It feels like a lot of our members are on@the verge of releasing Doppels...

group_1.textLeft: Time may heal these wounds, but even so...

group_1.textRight: It's our duty to ensure everyone's well-being.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, it helps to keep that in mind.

group_1.textCenter: First, I need to gather up the trash for tomorrow.
And we need to get the trays for the recycling@box...
(Is this...a story for one of Sana's picture books...?)

group_1.textRight: I'm home...

group_1.textLeft: Ah...

group_1.textRight: Yachiyo?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, it's not what it looks like...
I wasn't snooping through your rejected@manuscripts or anything like that...

group_1.textRight: Erm, it's fine...!@Tomorrow is garbage day, after all...!

group_1.textLeft: Now you're making me feel even more@suspicious...

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* You may be right...

group_1.textLeft: There's so many pages, though.@Is it really alright to throw them all away?

group_1.textRight: I got about halfway through the story,
but then I lost track of what I was trying to do...

group_1.textLeft: I see...
...What was the story?@Is it alright to ask?

group_1.textRight: Sure...!

group_1.narration: "Um, so there's a frog boy and a lizard boy.@The frog is trying to teach the lizard about his home,@the Pond Country, but the lizard doesn't know what@ponds are like, so he's completely confused..."
"The lizard asks his friends to draw@a picture of what the Pond looks like,@but they're all radically different depictions,@which makes him even more confused."
"The frog, however, is amazed at all@the different worlds that were born@through just a single explanation.@He's impressed by the imaginations@of all these creatures."

group_1.textRight: And...that's where I got stuck.

group_1.textLeft: I thought it was interesting.

group_1.textRight: But I lost all interest in writing it...
I think the main idea that I was trying@to convey is...
Isn't it wonderful that we all have so many@different worlds?

group_1.textLeft: It's a hard message to convey.

group_1.textRight: Right...
Though I hope to help people's hearts when@they read my books...
I worry my ideas won't be properly conveyed,@and they'll fail to save them...

group_1.textLeft: ...Because you couldn't save Iroha and Ui.

group_1.textRight: What makes you say that...?

group_1.textLeft: I've seen your mood growing darker.@I couldn't help but worry...
And I've been feeling helpless too.

group_1.textRight: I...sometimes wonder...
Are Iroha and Ui sad now that they're gone...?
Are they sad because everyone has@forgotten them...?
They were happy at first, but they might@regret it now...

group_1.textLeft: Hearing you say that, I realize I'm not as@pessimistic as you are.

group_1.textRight: But...why...?

group_1.textLeft: I don't think they're unhappy.

group_1.textRight: I just don't know if I can believe that...

group_1.textLeft: Well, it's only recently that I gained this belief.
Wait, that's it.
We have a day off tomorrow.@Let's all go somewhere.
